class.name: CobbAPIBatchMove
class.blurb: Functions for moving references in bulk, optionally with a world-relative offset.

description.p: This API allows you to move references in bulk, optionally with a world-relative offset.

To use the API, you call a function to create a BatchMove task; this function returns a numeric "handle," which is like a ticket that you can exchange to access your task. Once you have a handle, you can use additional functions to configure your task, and then call a final function to run the task and receive results.
A task can only be configured or used by the same Papyrus call stack that created it; you can't pass a handle to some other part of your mod and operate on it later.

args.arg: The numeric handle for a BatchMove task.

Three floats specifying an offset from akTarget's position. akSubject will be moved to the position of akTarget plus this offset. This argument is required, but if you don't want an offset, a quick shortcut is to pass new Float[3].

tr.td: A normal operation. The subject reference is moved to the target reference, with a position offset applied as appropriate.
If the subject reference is a load door, its destination door's teleport marker (so, the marker on the same side as the subject) is moved instead.
Your specified coordinates and target are ignored. The subject reference is moved back to its editor location.

args.arg: The numeric handle for a BatchMove task.

tr.td: The default. Do not modify load doors' teleport markers.
Move load door subjects' destinations' teleport markers (so, the markers on the subjects' side) in order to keep those markers in the same position relative to the subjects.

Move load doors' destinations' teleport markers: compute the offset from the load door's editor position to the marker's editor position, and maintain that exact offset from the load door's new position.
